column4: <Stanley00> somehow i cant edit it... the filename i found was just "wireshark" with the logo
<Stanley00> its blank...
just a min...
and did you run wireshark as root?
you can edit the .desktop file in /usr/share/applications/
yep, the file is wireshark.desktop
add gksu in the exec line :D
it will lokk like this "Exec=gksu wireshark"
try running "gksu gedit /usr/share/applications/wireshark.desktop"
I cant be, you installed wireshark from Ubuntu Software Center?
are you sure you type the file path correct?
It's not changed much, I still use template to create a desktop file as I need it
here is my template, in case you want it http://paste.ubuntu.com/744860/
and about the wireshark.desktop, did you edit it?
workin on it
here is my wireshark.desktop, added gksu, you can put it in ~/.local/share/applications too
http://paste.ubuntu.com/744865/
briantorch beat you too it lol... i jsut gotta put it in my app folder
thanks a bunch...
you are welcome :)
and briantorch: thank you both very much...
haha, you have to use the desktop file from braintorch, cause mine wont work at all. LOL
lol good thing i did...
I didnt know that if tryexec is equal to exec, it wont run... smartly =))
